name: ListPosthogNotebooks
description:
Retrieve a list of notebooks from Datadog.

Use this tool to get a list of notebooks associated with a specific project in Datadog. Ideal for viewing or managing notebooks within the Datadog platform.

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: The ID of the project you want to access notebooks for. Use /api/projects/ to find the ID.

value_schema.description: Project ID of the project you're trying to access. To find the ID of the project, make a call to /api/projects/.

parameters.name: filter_criteria
parameters.description: String to filter notebooks. Use colon-separated key-value pairs, separated by space or comma.

value_schema.description:
Filter for notebooks that match a provided filter.
                Each match pair is separated by a colon,
                multiple match pairs can be sent separated by a space or a comma

parameters.name: notebook_creator_uuid
parameters.description: The UUID of the notebook's creator. Use this to filter notebooks by their creator.

value_schema.description: The UUID of the Notebook's creator

parameters.name: filter_from_date
parameters.description: Filter for notebooks created after this specific date and time. The date should be provided in an appropriate format, such as ISO 8601.

value_schema.description: Filter for notebooks created after this date & time

parameters.name: filter_date_before
parameters.description: Filter for notebooks created before this specified date and time. Use ISO 8601 format (e.g., '2023-10-01T15:00:00Z').

value_schema.description: Filter for notebooks created before this date & time

parameters.name: results_per_page
parameters.description: Specifies the number of notebook results to return per page.

value_schema.description: Number of results to return per page.

parameters.name: starting_index_for_results
parameters.description: The index to start returning results from. This is used for pagination.

value_schema.description: The initial index from which to return the results.

parameters.name: filter_by_logged_in_user
parameters.description: Provide any value to filter results to notebooks created by the logged-in user.

value_schema.description: If any value is provided for this parameter, return notebooks created by the logged in user.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Datadog API.

parameters.name: contains
parameters.description:
Filter for notebooks that match a provided filter.
                Each match pair is separated by a colon,
                multiple match pairs can be sent separated by a space or a comma

value_schema.description:
Filter for notebooks that match a provided filter.
                Each match pair is separated by a colon,
                multiple match pairs can be sent separated by a space or a comma

parameters.name: created_by
parameters.description: The UUID of the Notebook's creator

value_schema.description: The UUID of the Notebook's creator

parameters.name: date_from
parameters.description: Filter for notebooks created after this date & time

value_schema.description: Filter for notebooks created after this date & time

parameters.name: date_to
parameters.description: Filter for notebooks created before this date & time

value_schema.description: Filter for notebooks created before this date & time

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

value_schema.description: Number of results to return per page.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The initial index from which to return the results.

value_schema.description: The initial index from which to return the results.

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: If any value is provided for this parameter, return notebooks created by the logged in user.

value_schema.description: If any value is provided for this parameter, return notebooks created by the logged in user.

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: Project ID of the project you're trying to access. To find the ID of the project, make a call to /api/projects/.

value_schema.description: Project ID of the project you're trying to access. To find the ID of the project, make a call to /api/projects/.
